Documentation for tooltips components.

Files

app/styles/modules/_tooltips.scss

Contents

  • Tooltip
  • Feature Highlight

Tooltip

Tooltip can display simple text information inside bubble next to component. There are few variations of how tooltips can be used. For example on text, on button, with or without tooltip icon. Tooltip can be created using [data-tooltip] attribute in conjunction with [title] attribute.

Javascript dependency

Tooltip component is wrapper plugin around Tippy.js. All methods and events are supported.

Example:
This text has tooltip

This is a content of hidden tooltip template

You can put more html here

This is a link within tooltip.

Code:
<em data-tooltip title="This is tooltip text">...</em>

<button class="btn btn--ghost" data-tooltip title="This is tooltip text <a href='#' class='link'>This is a link within tooltip.</a>">..</button>

<div class="hide" id="tooltip-light">
  <div class="card">
    <div class="card__content">
      <h3>This is a content of hidden tooltip template</h3>
      <p>You can put more html here</p>
      <p><a href='#' class="link">This is a link within tooltip.</a></p>
      <button class="btn btn-primary mb-none">Test</button>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
<button class="btn btn--ghost" data-tooltip="data-tooltip" data-tippy-theme="light" data-html="#tooltip-light">Tooltip from html template</button>

<svg class="icon icon-user icon--large" role="img" aria-hidden="true" data-tooltip data-tooltipped="" title="This is tooltip text on icon">.../svg>

Tooltip placements

Tooltip can be positioned on: top(default)/right/bottom/left with attribute data-tippy-placement as shown on example below.

Example:

Feature Highlight

Feature Highlight is a specialized tooltip designed to draw attention to new or important interface elements. It builds on the Tooltip component but provides a more prominent visual style with an interactive close button. Feature Highlights can be used for onboarding, guided tours, or announcing new features.

Example:
Code:
<button class="btn btn--primary" data-feature-highlight="button-example" data-tippy-content="This is a feature highlight with close button" data-close-text="Do not show again">Feature example</button>

Implementation Notes

Feature Highlights are automatically displayed with a success theme, positioned on top (or bottom on mobile devices), and include a close button. Each Feature Highlight can track when a user dismisses it to avoid showing it again.

Feature Highlight tooltips will remain visible until the user explicitly dismisses them with the close button or by clicking elsewhere. Once dismissed, the user's preference is saved in localStorage.

To implement a Feature Highlight in your code:

  • Add the data-feature-highlight attribute to any element
  • Use the data-close-text attribute to set the text for the close button
  • Provide a unique identifier value (e.g., data-feature-highlight="new-feature-id")
  • Add content using either data-tippy-content or data-html="#template-id"
  • The FeatureHighlight component will handle displaying, positioning, and tracking dismissals
